intro: Pterygodium connivens, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds covered in a fibrous coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
